vulnerabilityWithRemediation.description:
code-server is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issue due to how crafted input strings are mishandled.

An attacker could submit a crafted string that could cause excessive consumption of system resources that will impact stability and potentially cause a crash.

vulnerabilityWithRemediation.description: Code Server contains a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this issue by passing a crafted link to a user, which when opened could result in the loss of sensitive information such as session tokens and cookies.

vulnerabilityWithRemediation.description: DotNetZip.Semvered before 1.11.0 is vulnerable to directory traversal, allowing attackers to write to arbitrary files via a ../ (dot dot slash) in a Zip archive entry that is mishandled during extraction. This vulnerability is also known as 'Zip-Slip'.
vulnerabilityWithRemediation.remediationComment: BDSA Auto-remediated: BDSA-2018-1821 is related to CVE-2018-1002205, but the BDSA team has determined that this component version is not affected.

vulnerabilityWithRemediation.description: jQuery contains commented references to the hijacked domain `blindsignals`, within the files `src/queue/delay.js` and `test/data/jquery-1.9.1.js` (the former referring to a Web Archive version of the original site). Users without awareness of the domain's status could be exposed to unspecified attacks if they attempt to follow the links to the hijacked site.
vulnerabilityWithRemediation.remediationComment: comment in the code only - no real risk

vulnerabilityWithRemediation.description: It was discovered that jQuery could allow for cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities to be introduced if `jQuery.htmlPrefilter` method is used. Attackers could exploit XSS vulnerabilities to execute JavaScript code in a target's browser by tricking them into accessing the vulnerable page. This would allow an attacker to steal an administrator's session tokens or execute arbitrary code on their behalf by sending the link to an unsuspecting user or waiting for them to discover it.

vulnerabilityWithRemediation.description: It was discovered that jQuery could allow for cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities to be introduced if certain HTML is passed to Document Object Model (DOM) manipulation methods. Attackers could exploit XSS vulnerabilities to execute JavaScript code in a target browser by tricking them into accessing the vulnerable page. This would allow an attacker to steal an administrator's session tokens or execute arbitrary code on their behalf by sending the link to an unsuspecting user or waiting for them to discover it.
